posts.text:
China’s government has thrown money at humanoid robotics. But accompanying the buzz is a sense among executives and investors that the industry is starting to get ahead of itself http://econ.st/4ryrygA

posts.author: TheEconomist

posts.text:
Bullish oil bets are surging:

Brent crude call option volumes surged to a record 5.8 million contracts in January.

This is followed by 3.5 million contracts so far in February, one of the highest readings on record, with one week of trading still remaining.

By comparison, the previous peak was 5.7 million in October 2024, which came amid tensions between Iran and Israel.

The current surge is driven by fears of a US strike on Iran, with President Trump considering military action after amassing the largest US force in the region since 2003.

As a result, the oil market is off to its strongest start to a year since 2022, with prices rising +15% YTD.

Oil market positioning has rarely been this bullish.
posts.author: KobeissiLetter

posts.text:
As the skeptics are likely to come attack with the shares moving up.  The point about capacity will be continually raised for $hg $hgraf

It’s cookie cutter.  Off the shelf components mostly.   As grok or other ai’s. Texas used to have huge acetylene capacity.  The Ai’s suggest that Texas could ramp up enough acetylene production for $hg to produce 100k tonnes of graphene per year over just 4-7 years.  100k tonnes would be $20 bln a year profit.  Capacity growth can meet explosive demand as it materializes
posts.author: BambroughKevin
